N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2371.7 - Requests for amendment or correction of records

State Regulations
(a) All requests for amendment or correction
of records shall be made in writing upon a prescribed form provided by the
department, and such request shall describe the record sought to be amended or
corrected in reasonable detail. All such requests shall be addressed to the

Privacy Compliance Officer, Building 9, State Campus, Albany, NY
12227. (b) The privacy compliance
officer shall, within 30 business days after receipt of a request for amendment
or correction: (1)
make the requested
amendment or correction in whole or in part and, in addition, inform the data
subject that, upon request, such amendment or correction will be provided to
any person or governmental unit to which the record has been or is disclosed
pursuant to section 94.3(c) of the Public Officers Law; or
(2)
inform the requestor in writing of the
refusal to amend or correct, explaining the reasons for such refusal. The
privacy compliance officer shall also advise the requestor of the right to
appeal the refusal pursuant to section
2371.8
of this

Part and shall identify the person to whom an appeal may be directed. (c) If a request for amendment or
correction of a record is neither granted nor refused within 30 business days
after the receipt by the privacy compliance officer of such request, the
request shall be deemed refused. Any such refusal may be appealed as provided
in section
2371.8
of this

Part. Notes
